channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large and deep pothole on the edge of the road, 7th February
item.description:
Large and deep pothole on the edge of the narrowest part of Gambles Lane which has progressively become deeper causing drivers to ground their vehicle. My son has recently had to repair his mini due to the front suspension breaking, flat tyre and buckled front wheel. We live up this lane so have no choice but two use it !! What 3 Words - ///blissful.grownup.interview

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unacceptable amount of rubble in road, 7th February
item.description:
I was driving up Kidnappers Lane last evening in the dark and the rain and was forced up against the kerb by a passing car. My car suffered a serious jolt which I thought must be a pothole. (There are certainly plenty of them thanks to all of the building work that is going on.) When I walked there this morning I realised it must have been the amount of debris, chunks of tarmac that must have been washed there. May I suggest that Kidnappers Lane is monitored regularly as it is currently not fit for purpose because of the amount of traffic caused by the unending building and road works in the area. It is called a “lane” for a reason - the dictionary defines it as a “narrow country road”. I have already had one flat tyre thanks to Newland Homes. The lane needs to be properly and regularly cleaned and cleared.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 7th February
item.description:
This was initially reported by myself on Tuesday 13 January 2026. FixMyStreet ref: 8680738. I then received an email to say that this had been resolved. The issue has not been resolved. There are multiple potholes between the car park on Daisy bank Road up to and including directly outside Fir cottage. They are now worse than they were one month ago. These are different to potholes those reported at the end of 2025. They need investigating and fixing. It makes it tricky to drive along this section without potentially causing damage to road users tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Standard Gauge Incline, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Length of road flooded, drain and pipework blocked, 7th February
item.description:
Continual problems with this area, drains and pipes never cleaned out properly. Water extends on to footpath which is dangerous for walkers and from splashing from cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Bouncers Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Both sides of the pedestrian crossing have poor drainage and often have very large puddles. It is not possible to wait for the crossing within range of the pedestrian sensor without very high risk of being splashed by a passing vehicle. This makes it very difficult to use the crossing. I would imagine the disabled users would find it impossible to cross., 7th February
